column4: Can anyone here tell me how to connect to my mobile phone to notebook using Infrared?
HOw do I activate the Infrared
does lspci show it?
it may come up as an IrDA device
No.
or may say infared
try lsusb
it may be attatched to the usb bus
Nothing their either... Only thing remotely possible is the Wireless ethernet. :(
is it enabled in the bios?
No idea...  I presumed it was... shall I reboot and check?
i would as a starting point
Okay, let me do that then... be back in a bit.
Okay, it was disabled in the BIOS.  I enabled it, but lspci and lsusb still show nothing that looks like it is an Infrared.
can you pastebin both outputs please, use a single link too ;)
pretty much sets up your entire laptop :D
:)  Let me have a looksie.

Okay, I checked that site out and it does not seem to say much about using the Infrared.  I did run a sudo irdadump and it scrolled some info but nothing that really helps me to know whether it is trying to connect to my mobile phone or not.
we just need to get the infared working first
I know :\
if you run lsmod and make sure you have all the same modules as are listed in the link I gave then you should be ok
Hmmm... I see.
Can you at least tlel me how to communicate with the IRDA?
i've never used it. I thought it was kinda defunct now with bluetooth being so prollific
Okay.
Just wnated to see if I could do it... but seems it is beyond me.
i'd have a go if you get free time, i'm sure its achievable
try: sudo findchip -v
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-253388.html
try: ls /dev/ir*
nothing
maybe its just a generic case but theres no IR sender/reciever
I think I am too dumb for this.
just keep at it. as far as the guides have said I dont think it has infared. But i could be wrong. Have a swing at it if you get time. IBM supprt linux very well
check http://www-307.ibm.com/pc/support/site.wss/document.do?lndocid=MIGR-55318  There is says (and shows a picture) of the infrared port.
doesnt mean theres an IR sender behind it
dos the system have windows on it too?
No.
check in language under administration (remembering here, I'm on the move)
Okay, be right back.
cd /var/cache/apt/archives; sudo dpkg -i ./*.deb
when you get your new allowance, complete the upgrade
I hear you... and you dajhorn ... Ai, just that the system is really uncomfortable... but I will hold out then.
if you are jumping to the next release, grab the alternate cd iso at a friends place / work. burn it after md5 testing it then use that ;)
boot to root recovery mode and do it there
But what do I do?
You mean do the xorg -configure form the boot recovery?
hold shift at boot, select recovery mode then select root.  You cannot run that command with an active x running as far as I remember
Or activate root from boot recovery?
Thank you :)
I think he wants to know how to add Windows 7 to his grub loader as a bootable option.
now you meantion it...yeah seems that way
maybe kill the xorg process. You will lose any unsavedwork. Does K+ALT+PrintScreen not kill it?
its the kill X combo because some folks (I have no idea who) were presing it and losing work, or similar
if your ubuntu is 64bit there is a ppa for 64bit flash. There is also o
i'd say it was all linux_hacks ;-)
use bleachbit carefully as root and your user with as many apps closed as possible
I believe evolution can use PST files
can you give a PASTEBIN of the output of:  lsb_release -a; uname -a; dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1148957/
sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplugin-installer flashplugin-nonfree libswfdec-0.8-0 swfdec-mozilla      then enable the partner repo and install adobe-flashplugin
Lucid desktop support dies in April 2013, I suggest you upgrade soon
Um, let me try that.... Wish me luck.
Will do, thank you.
that lotwill give you 64bit flash for your 64it OS, should be ok
If the sudo apt-get install adobe-flashplugin works without activating the partner repo does that mean it was already activated previously?
yes, thats where the package comes from :)
Okies, busy downlaoding the adobe-flashplugin.  thank you.
should be a bit better
I am back, and it worked perfectly.  Thank you.
np dude :)
it can, yes
Oh, then something else went wrong with ym NT4 installation in virtualbox.
does NT4 work in vbox?
I do not know.  I tried Virtualbox
then I suggest you check the vbox site to check, should've done that first really...
I presumes Virtualbox would have done the trick for me.
it doesn't work with every OS ever
https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Guest_OSes    for example PCBSD won't run
is yourinstall media up to SP6a?
it may help, you can add the repo and install easier
libreoffice is a fork of openoffice
depends on taste
mutt, clawsmail, thunderbird, kmail are 4 I can think of quickly. Depends how much space you have for deps to install kmail
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/list-of-email-clients-available-in-ubuntu-linux.html
i use unity-mail which tells me when I have a gmail, i can then use web mail
can you give a pastebin of the output of:  lsb_release -a; uname -a; dpkg -l | egrep 'flash|gnash|swf|spark'     Thanks
http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/1210444/
if you are using Chrome you can uninstall flashplugin-installer and get flash as it is already in the browser
I am using Chromium.
Do you advise me to uninstall Chromium and install Chrome instead?
ah, then uninstall the flashplugin-installer package and enable the partner repo and install adobe-flashplugin. Natty is EOL next month so you may want to consider updating
kay, thank you.
